item.title: Fly tipping - adjacent to 81 Battle road, 30th December
item.description:
Ongoing issue of waste being regularly dumped on the passageway adjacent to 81 Battle Road DA17 6DU. Obstructing the right of way, causing inconvenience, potential safety hazards and hygiene concerns As this passageway is public land I kindly request that the council to arrange for the prompt removal of waste currently dumped on the passageway. Also requesting to take appropriate enforcement actions to prevent further illegal dumping and considering installing measures such as signage to deter repeated waste Dumping in this area.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Battle Road, Northumberland Heath, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Street gullies blocked by leaves, 30th December
item.description:
There are many blocked drain gullies in West way,willett way ,kingsway and wood ride,which could cause serious flooding to crossway This requires urgent attention,to every gulley in Petts Wood
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): West Way, Poverest, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Damage to property, 30th December
item.description:
I have a large tree dangerously close to the rear of my property. It is very close to my garage wall on public land in a small open space at the rear of 26 Chestnut Drive. I fear if left unaddressed it will cause considerable damage to my property. Please see photos attached. I have raised this issue previously and received very little in way of response. If you require any further information please contact me.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Chestnut Drive, Welling, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Large branches falling from street trees, 30th December
item.description:
These are large branches not twigs outside 116 Kent House Road which have fallen into the street from unpruned street trees! I have reported this already and been told that Bromley Council won’t do anything. Will it take for someone to be injured before these trees are made safe?

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Kent House Road, New Beckenham, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Scheduled Sunday 28 December carriageway cleaning…., 30th December
item.description:
….not undertaken, see attached photos as at 1pm Tuesday 30 December. Please explain why the carriageways and footways are NOT cleaned as per the schedule on the Council’s website. This has been a perennial problem and appears to be getting worse. Why? Failure to PROPERLY clear the footways and carriageways in a timely fashion, inter alia, leads to blocked, silted up drains, which as the 2024 drain cleaning ‘exercise’ showed the Council was unable to undertake in a competent manner…. You MUST do better in 2026…..

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Lubbock Road, Elmstead, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: 86 88 shoot up hill, 30th December
item.description:
Road is covered in patches rather than one continous fix up. Signidicant dips especially on the aide of bus lane so buses and heavy vehiclea fall into dipa and shakw up ground. A celing in my apartment qas renovated 6 mknths ago but as a reaults of the vibrations the cracks have appeared on it.
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Shoot-Up Hill, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: 86 and 88 shoot up Hill, 30th December
item.description:
Part of the damage to the road was fixed a couple of months ago but patches of significant dips on bus route / lane create shaking of the house foundations. Cracks have appeared on the ceilings of several apartments.
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Shoot-Up Hill, London

item.title: Drains damaged and flooding on both sides of the road, 30th December
item.description:
Drains damaged on both sides of the road. They are also flooding. They were previously repaired but everything that was dug up was put into the drain and it is now blocked, which floods and causes the road damage around it. Cyclists have to manoeuvre round into traffic
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Upton Road, Blendon, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Number 8 leaving building rubbish blocking the footpath. Didnt get a photo, but saw a old lady struggling to grt past with her walking aid., 30th December
item.description:
Number 8, leaving countless pallets and disposed building rubbish, water tanks , and planks of wood, across the whole footpath, making it difficult to pass. A pram or wheelchair would not be able to pass. Saw a old lady struggling to pass with her walking aid.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 3, Byron Drive, Hampstead Garden Suburb, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet
